lines.text: You guys really have an attachment for that kid, don't you?
Yes. He was our master.
Well, that's real nice, and any day now, he might come romping back, huh? He'll just come whistling through that door, and everything will be the same. Real peachy-keen-like.
Uh-huh.
It's a possibility.
Well, at least we try to be optimistic.

[shouts]
Optimistic? Somebody try to untie the knot in this guy's cord!
Why don't you just shut off?
Hey, I'm really scared there, Kirby. What are you going to do, suck me to death?
Things could be worse, you know.
How?
How what?
How could they be worse?
They couldn't; I lied.

So... It's back to that stupid static again. You think I don't know what's going on in here? I know what goes on in this cottage. It's a conspiracy and every one of you low-watts is in on it. Just 'cause you move around, you think you're better than I am. I'm not an invalid. I was designed to stick in the wall! I like being stuck in the stupid wall! I can't help it if the kid was too short to reach my dials...
[Begins to spark and fizzle furiously]
We didn't mean it. Really!

[bellows]
IT'S MY FUNCTION!
[continues sparking and fizzing and glowing]
No, wait. Wait!
He's gonna blow!
Quick, yank your plugs!
[the appliances all unplug themselves just as Air Conditioner blows up]
Poor Air Conditioner.
I didn't think he'd take it so hard.
Ah, he was a jerk anyway.
Boy, are we glad to see you!
Yeah. I really thought I'd turned in my warranty that time.
Until baggy here showed up!
I just slipped and fell in. That's all.

[laughing]
Oh, yeah, sure, right.
You can't fool us. We love you.
That's right, like Mrs. Roosevelt loved her husband.
Yeah, yeah. Well, here's the shore. Everybody off.
Listen to this! This is President Roosevelt awarding the vaccum the medal of honor!
[Radio places a leaf on Kirby's face, but Kirby blows it off, and everyone laughs]
the open road, the smell of the wind in my face, the flies clogging up my grill.
So... uh... what's this thing with you and the Blanket?
What thing?
You know. All of a sudden, you're being so darned NICE to him all of a sudden.
Oh, that. I was just thinking, and I got this feeling I should be nicer to him for a change, you know? And now I feel better.
Wow, that's weird.
What's weird about it?

I don't know. I mean, you were never this nice to him before, and all of a sudden now you're nice to him all the time, and I don't know. I'm, uh, I'm just trying to understand, trying to figure out, what it all means.
Well, it's kind of hard to describe. It's like being next to a new loaf of bread.
[Lampy looks puzzled]
Hmmm. It's, um, let's see... it's like a warm, toasty feeling inside.
[Lampy scratches his head]
It's like a glow...
A glow!
Yeah.
I think I know what you're talking about! It's like the feeling I get when I think about the Master.
Well, you can do what you like. We're not gonna give up hope.
That's real touchin', Toaster. You're gonna get me bawling like a baby anytime now.
I think you're jealous.
Sure, I'm jealous of a bunch of dimwits.
Dim?
Yeah, because the master never played with you.
Because you're stuck in a wall!
I remember the first time my bulb burned out. And I thought, "That's it! I'm burnt out! Eighty-sixed! To the showers!" But then the master gave me a brand new bulb... and I just glowed.
Legs would help, you know.
Brains wouldn't hurt either.
Lay off.
Yeah, pipe down, carpet-breath.
Really, now, why don't you just go out and find a new one?
Are you kidding? Where am I gonna find another toaster like this?
[Shows her badly damaged Toaster]
Like that? Probably nowhere.

[off-screen from a distance]
Help me! I'm stuck!
I hear him.
I don't see him anywhere.
Maybe he's calling from Blanket Heaven. He's a white, fluffly little angel with a knob-nose.
He's just stuck in a tree, that's all! Look!
Why if it isn't ol' Rabbit Ears!
Why if it isn't ol' loudmouth!
Hey, TV!
How ya doing?
Oh, I've got a few more seasons left.
The cabin hasn't been the same since they took you away.
Yeah, it wasn't as noisy.

[grinning]
Well I see you haven't changed.

[sinking in the mud]
Well, this concludes our broadcast day, or week... actually, this concludes all broadcasting of any sort. We'll try to leave you with a suitable tune
[plays Al Jolson singing "Mammy"]

[bumps into a car]
Oh, were you in line here first? Of course! Pardon me.

[singing]
I once ran the Indy 500. I must confess, I'm impressed how I did and I wonder how close that I came. Now I get a sinking sensation; I was the top of the line, out of sight, out of mind, so much for fortune and fame.
Hey, look at me! I mean, really! Barf, barf, barf! I'm a can opener, a lamp and a shaver! Oh, god! I'm a mish-mash!
Well, I'm going with or without you.
Well, I say we stay. We're gonna have a new master anyway once someone buys this cottage.
But I don't want a new master! I want our master!
Well? What about the rest of you?
You boys are gonna need a leader! Why, alone, you wouldn't last more than five minutes out there! I was once a mountaineer, see? And together, we can stand against the forces of nature!
Were you really a mountaineer?
Sure. Ask anybody. Ask Teddy Roosevelt. Why, we shoot moose together on the Klondike.
Wow. Well, you know, I was thinking, you guys are gonna need someone bright along too.
Good idea.

[whispering]
Run.
"You're worthless."
[last lines]

[as he and his friends head off to college, laughs]
Oh, I'm aching from joy!
I think Houdini did this once, and if I remember right, he was out of the hospital in no time.
Well, that's encouraging.
The whole bunch of you gotta have a combined wattage of maybe five, maybe less. It's been years. It's scrap metal time.
He's not home.
We'll have to wait.
No. Let's wait inside!
But it's locked.
Luckily, my war training included inter-appliance codes. I will simply render the secret appliance knock, and we'll be welcomed by the native machinery. Stand aside, my meager companion!
[Radio knocks Lampy off the bed]
Holy Mother of Edison! What were you thinking? You could have broken my bulb!
Hey, come over here. I'm gonna...
Why, do you dare to cross foils with the greatest Saxon swordsman in the land? Haven't you the slightest idea who you're dealing with?
Precisely - a total idiot!
If you sabre wags as loosely as your Norman tongue, you'll be run through in an instant. Defend yourself, Sir Lampy of Locksley!
[the Radio continually whacks Lampy with his antenna, Blanky falls on them]
A blow for Richard! A blow for Marion! A blow for Mario, the garbage man! And for Carl and all the boys at the delicatessen! And here's one for the guys on 5th street!
Do we have to stop here?
Only for a while.
Just long enough to lose our minds! We'll be cannibals within a few days, I've seen it happen!
And you'll be the first to go, dial-face.
The battery's gone dead!
We're trapped here like rats! Small little rats with no hair and one leg!

[points at the sun]
Look, Lampy, from here you can see the really BIG lamp.
WOW! I wonder where his switch is?
[the Radio is navigating the journey]
North by northwest. Watch out for low-flying aircraft.
[Toaster notices Kirby is reluctant to come]
You know, we could use someone who's really... strong!
And loud!
And grumpy!
And oblivious to reality!
Oh, come off it! Be serious.
I *am* serious!
You're insane!
Why, if we were all wiener dogs, our problems would be solved.
What?
Or maybe it was a basset hound.
You're *all* insane!

[thinking Kirby is a whale]
Damn thee, accursed whale! By the depths of Hell I stabbeth thee!
Climb on, you idiot!
Oh, it's you.
Where's Toaster?
He sank!
If a dog can do it, WE can do it!
But a dog has legs.
Ah, don't be a wet blanket.

[uf the Master]
He's not coming back anyway.
He might. The fact is there's just not enough fact.
What is it with you guys, anyway? You act like you just came off the assembly line! Now get this through your chrome. We've been dumped! Abandoned!
But he loved us.
That's right.
So what? He's a kid. He has a family. They move away, he moves away. It's a packaged deal.
But maybe they're...
He's not coming back! Pure and simple!
Oh yeah? Did you talk to him recently or something? They could drive up any second!
You really think so?
I'm not talking to you!
What are you laughing at?
Absolutely nothing, nothing at all.
I think he was laughing at us.
You know something? You're a bright little lamp.
Thanks... Hey!
You know, guys? We are going to need some kind of shelter.
Yeah. Shelter for the likes of them.
Come over here and say that, chrome dome.
What?
Oh sorry about that. I meant to say, "Vacuous vacuum".
Boy if he gonna be surprised when he gets back. He just left a little while ago to drive out to the cab...
[Plugsy switches the station; an announcer speaks Spanish]
Hey!
What's the idea?
Oh, many pardons. Was you watchin' that channel?

[Elmo St. Peters had fainted after the appliances scared him half to death and escaped]
Did I catch ya at a bad time? Just wondering if you got my radio tubes.

President Roosevelt has declared today a national holiday in honor of those five amazing appliances we've all been hearing about. So lock up the office, take down the top and open that rumble seat. Last one to Coney Island is a party pooper. From the starlight roof high atop the Ritz, we wish our intrepid little friends the best of luck and a fond farewell.
Ah, you're all a bunch of junk.
[They all laugh]
Hey, what about Rooney's down on 53rd? They've got like used vacuums and junk.
Rooney's vacuums found to be uh... um... carcinogenic in recent lab tests. Big, big tumors on those rats. Bleagh! We've got photos to prove it,
[photos of showgirls]
and I don't even wanna look at them. Uhh!
Boy, he sure has grown!
Look at him! What a heartbreaker!
He graduated too!
Of course. He knows how to work hard.
He's all big now. I hope he still needs us.

[good-naturedly]
Still needs ya? That's the silliest thing I've ever heard!

Why wander endlessly through this sprawling wasteland they dare to call a city when your dreams are all under one roof? Our roof! Corner of 3rd and East. Crazy Ernie's Amazing Emporium of... of... TOTAL BARGAIN MADNESS!
[Burts out laughing and collapses]
Have you ever heard of this place before? Looks pretty neat.
Why, I don't believe I've ever seen quite so many smiles before.
I've never seen contraptions with so many buttons and knobs and dials before.
Naturally, we are on the cutting edge of technology.
Wow.
Well, what does that mean?
I don't know. What's that mean?
Plugsy.
Yeah?
Did you hear that? He's taking some old... STUFF to the dorm instead of us.
There may be lions in there...
And tigers and bears. Oh my.

[sarcastically]
He's such a baby! Ma-maa!
[first lines]
Good morning, good morning, gooooood morning!
What do you mean what are we going to do today? The same thing we've done for the last 2000 days! Chores!
Chores?
It'll be fun.
Fun? I'm up for some fun. Listen to this, a broadcast from Wrigley Field. It's the bottom of the ninth...
[Lampy shuts Radio off]
I don't see how doing chores is supposed to be fun.
It's not supposed to be fun. It's work.
I don't like to work without the master.
Well, okay. If you guys don't want to work, why don't we play a game?
A game? What sort of a game?
What are the rules?
There's only one rule... no one stops until the house is clean.
Boo!
Hey, everybody! Look! A clearing!
Great. Let's spread out the blanket and have a picnic.
But I'm full of stickers!
Well, my bag's full of thistles and sticks and who knows what else! Who's idea was it to come this way, anyway?
Why, it was the lamp's, I tell ya!
Oh, yeah? Who's supposed to be the big shot navigator around here, Mr. Loudmouth? Mr. Big Loudmouth?
Yeah!
Where are we, anyway?
Now, look here, fellas, just give me a second and I... Whoa, listen to this! It's the top of the ninth, the bases are loaded, and... PeeWee Reese is at the plate! There's the pitch, and he hits!
[he hits a rock which bounces off everyone else]
Oh, and it's a triple play!

Hey, I've got an idea! We can all get on top of the bed, and Kirby can push us!... No, no, no... Hey! What about the master's pogo stick?... No, no, no... Hey! Why don't we get the refrigerator on a skateboard, and Kirby can pull?... No, no, no... Hey!
Shut up! Shut up!
SHUT UP!
Let somebody else try for a change!
[makes everyone stand on top of Blanky]
Arise, Hassan, arise, O magic carpet...
Oww!
What's wrong?
He stepped on me!
Did not!
Did too!
Did not!
Did too!
Did not!
Hey, hey, hey, come on! How do you guys expect us to get there if you're fighting all the time?
You mean we're not there yet?

[chuckles]
No, not yet. We've got a long way to go.
Oh, boy! You're telling me!

[They approach the waterfall and Kirby freaks out and tries to swallow his cord]
Kirby, no!
Get the cord out of his mouth, don't let him swallow it!
Switch him off!
[Toaster jumps on Kirby and flips his switch]
Rob, are you sure you have enough underwear?
Mom, you packed enough underwear to stock the whole dorm.
Did you pack enough socks?
Look, Mom, I'm not going to Jupiter or anything, I'm going to college. It's just college.
Just give me something to worry about.

[talking over his mother]
I'm your mother.
[Blanky has gone up to the attic to see if the master is coming; when he doesn't, Blanky starts crying]
Well, was it him?
[Toaster glares at him]
I was just wondering whether or not it was him. I hate being left in the dark, you know.
[Blanky climbs back down, crying]
So we can assume that it wasn't him?
Let's get back to work.
Get ready, you devil dogs, because the master bebop blaster of all time is about to give you a soul injection!
Now where did that radio go? I could have sworn I left it right here in this very spot. What did it do, just get up and walk away?
Are you sure this is the right way?
I'm as sure as I am honest.
In that case, we're definitely lost.

[panicked to Toaster]
You gotta help me, you gotta hide me! Bread, I can get you bread, mountains of hot cross buns...
Radio, pull yourself together.
Sorry for that little interruption, folks. We'll return to our regularly-scheduled program momentarily.

[Blanky cries after Rob hasn't returned; of the photo]
Cry, cry, weep, wail and snob! It's disgusting! Every time! I can't believe it! Every single. Give me that stupid thing!

[singing]
Since you came here uninvited/We all knew you'd be delighted./This is not the time or place to hedge./ No one here would be so bold to,/But since you asked and no one's told you,/Let us take you to the cutting edge!

[rapping]
I can process words, accounting too./And my pixel screen displays for you./Computer graphics locked into your memory.

[rapping]
With fiber optics cast in plastic/For natural sights and sound fantastic./Just reach out and talk to your dear old Uncle Emery!

[singing]
More, more, more!
Everything you wanted and more.

[singing]
More, more, more!

[singing]
Let me tell you what it's for./Here's the printout with the score./Get yourself together on the edge.

[singing]
You want to go to old Rio De Janeiro, my dear?/You want to join in any Club Paradise?/You'd really rather stay at home, where the picture is clear./You get it on the stereo./And you don't even have to go./More, more, more!/ Everything you wanted and more!/More, more, more!
Any time or place you wish,/You might meet up with some dish./Pull yourself together on the edge!

[rapping]
If you want a lean machine/ To whip you up some mean cuisine,/I'm on ze scene, totally automatic.

[rapping]
Hey, I can bake your biscuits, too./ Pop some dough, boy, out for you./I'm micro-solid state and that's no static!

[singing]
More, more, more!/ Everything you wanted and more!/More, more, more!/ We're the bytes and chips to call./You just have yourself a ball./ It's all hyperactive on the edge!/From LEDs to CRTs,/ Woofers, tweeters, antenna trees,/ And ultra-nylon life of ease./Everything you dreamed of on the edge!
And more!
You can just take some of our things. Oh, this lamp will look so cute in your dorm room.
Go for it!
Well, what are you going to read by, then?
Oh, I'll buy some candles. I won't read. I'll go out.
Thanks, Mom, but I'm not taking any of your stuff. I'll just pick up some cheap stuff at some old appliance store like... whatever.
That's right, folks! Appliances! Cheap appliances! Available now at Ernie's Disposal!
Where's a good bargain place around here?
You should have gone for the new stuff.
A bargain in every buck! A buck in every pocket! A pocket in... um... every trouser! Ernie's Bargain Circus, where you ride the Ferris Wheel of Values for a better tomorrow!

[singing]
Once drove a surfer to sunset./There were bikinis/and buns filled with weenies./Believe me, just couldn't forget./Pico, lets go up to Zuma./Pico, lets go up to Zuma./From Zuma to Yuma,/the rumor was I had a hand/in the lay of the land./Get up and go hit the highway.

[singing]
There goes the sun, here comes the night. Somebody turn on the light. Somebody tell me that fate has been kind.

[singing]
You can't go out! You are out of your mind!
You can't even hear your own thoughts around here with all the racket around here.
Hey. Hey. What's that?
A car!
I don't want to hear another word about cars!
You said it.
It sounds pretty close.
Just don't even start!
Sounds real close!
We are pioneers! Whoa!
This is my sleeping place, see? And nobody crosses this line!
00, as usual!
What are you complaining about? You didn't do any work today.
Hang on tight, Blanky!
I am!
Don't let the tremendous height scare you.
Just shorted right out.
Cracked up and snapped. He sold the farm. Poor chap.
How does he look?
A little better than you, actually.
Lay off! Just lay off!
What's the matter?
We were worried about you.
You had us real scared there, pal.
Well, there's nothing wrong with me, pal! Just back off!
Don't be angry.
Just keep your antenneas and knobs and wires and ribbons off my chrome! Who needs you guys, anyway? Gotta drag you around all the time, bunch of dead weight! I'd be better off without you!
But Kirby...
Especially you, you little rag!
[pauses for a while, then turns to the waterfall]
So, uh... how do we get across this thing, anyway?

[after he falls into a mud hole]
I knew I shouldn't have let you guys drive.
[he starts sinking]
Oh, this is great fun! Let's make these outings a regular thing, okay?
[repeated line]
Listen to this!
